name: EntangleBrush
author: QuantumBrush Developer
long_description:
EntangleBrush uses quantum entanglement to create correlated color transformations across different parts of your stroke. When you paint, the brush pairs up segments of your stroke and entangles their quantum color states using Bell states and CNOT gates.

As the quantum states evolve, the entangled pairs influence each otherâ€”changes in one color segment cause corresponding changes in its entangled partner. This creates a unique visual effect where colors seem to 'communicate' with each other through quantum mechanics.

The number of Entanglement Pairs determines how many pairs of segments will be created and entangled. The Strength parameter controls how much the quantum evolution affects the original colors. Higher strength values create more dramatic color shifts, while lower values provide subtle quantum-inspired variations.

This brush demonstrates the non-local correlations inherent in quantum entanglement, where measurements on one part of an entangled system instantaneously affect the other, even when they are spatially separatedâ€”a phenomenon that Einstein called 'spooky action at a distance'.
